newsitem.title: USA: Mass. Gov. slams Legislature for killing tax cuts.
newsitem.headline: Mass. Gov. slams Legislature for killing tax cuts.

text.p: Massachusetts Gov. William Weld on Tuesday slammed the state Legislature for not approving any of the seven tax cuts he proposed in his $18.4 billion budget.
Weld, a Republican, proposed seven tax cut amendments and the Democratically controlled Legislature had failed to pass any of them by Tuesday afternoon.

"It's outrageous that the Legislature is deep sixing these tax cuts on the same day 4 million Massachusetts taxpayers are paying their income taxes," Weld told reporters at a State House news conference.

House Democrats ordered that three of the tax cut amendments, incluing an increase in the dependent child deduction, a repeal of the tax on veterans' pension benefits, and a cut in the tax rate on interest and dividends be studied. The move effectively kills the measures for this year.
House debate on the budget was set continue through Tuesday evening.
